condition.name: Blinded
entries: A Blinded creature can’t see, can’t begin Aiming (see the condition), and automatically fails any ability check that requires sight.
If a creature is Blinded while Aiming, the Aiming condition immediately ends for them.
Attack rolls against the creature have advantage, and the creature’s attack rolls have disadvantage.

condition.name: Invisible
entries: An Invisible creature is impossible to see without the aid of magic or a special sense. For the purpose of hiding, the creature is heavily obscured. The creature's location can be detected by any noise they make, any tracks they leave, by scent, or by scanners.

condition.name: Invisible
entries: An Invisible creature is impossible to see without the aid of magic or a special sense. For the purpose of hiding, the creature is heavily obscured. The creature's location can be detected by any noise they make, any tracks they leave, by scent, or by scanners.

condition.name: Prone
entries: A Prone creature’s only movement option is to crawl, unless they stand up and end the condition.
The creature has disadvantage on attack rolls.

Attack rolls against the creature have disadvantage if the attacker is not Aiming, or if the attacker is not within 5 feet of the creature. If the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature, the attacker has advantage on its attack roll.

condition.name: Active Camouflage
entries: A creature under the effects of active camouflage is Invisible (see the condition).

If the creature makes an attack roll, damage roll, or causes a target to make a saving throw, the condition immediately ends after applying relevant effects to the attack roll, damage throw, or saving throw.

condition.name: Aiming
entries: A creature that is Aiming when they take a shot with a weapon with scope ranges can take that shot normally up to the weapon’s extended range. They can also take a shot against a target within the weapon’s maximum range, but that attack is granted disadvantage.
A creature that is Aiming cannot make opportunity attacks.

condition.name: Burning
entries: A Burning creature cannot recover health points or energy shield points.
Burning creatures have disadvantage on their attack rolls.

condition.name: Combat Prone
entries: A Combat-Prone creature’s only movement option is to crawl, unless they stand up and end the condition.
It costs no movement for a Combat-Prone creature to begin Aiming with a medium- or long- range firearm.
Combat-Prone creatures have disadvantage on attack rolls they make, unless the attack is with a firearm or ranged weapon with a medium- or long-range scope.

Attack rolls against the creature have disadvantage if the attacker is not Aiming, or if the attacker is not within 5 feet of the creature, If the attacker is within 5 feet of the creature, the attacker has advantage on its attack roll.

condition.name: Electrified
entries: An Electrified creature has their speed halved.

At the start of the creature’s turn, they must roll a d6. On a roll of 3 or lower, the creature becomes Paralyzed until the start of their next turn, or until the Electrified condition ends for them, whichever happens first.

condition.name: Empowered
entries: Empowered comes in one of three stages: Stage 1, Stage 2, or Stage 3. You only take into consideration the highest stage of empowerment you have at any given time. Empowerment stages do not stack.

An Empowered (Stage 1) creature can increase the damage of weapon attacks they make for their Attack action by 1d4. At Stage 2 this becomes an increase of 1d6, and at Stage 3 it becomes an increase of 1d8.

condition.name: Suppressed
entries: A Suppressed creature cannot cast a Light ability, cannot cast a spell, and cannot make recharge rolls.
If a creature is Suppressed while concentrating, their concentration immediately ends.
Creatures cannot begin concentrating on anything while Suppressed.

condition.name: Tethered
entries: A Tethered creature is Suppressed and Weakened (see the conditions).
If a creature is moved out of range of the source of the effect, they are no longer Tethered.

condition.name: Weakened
entries: If a creature has a resistance to a damage type, it loses that resistance while Weakened.
The creature makes attack rolls and ability checks with disadvantage.

trait.name: Vehicle Proficiencies
entries: heavy pike, pike

trait.name: Mob Mentality
entries: The dreg has advantage on weapon
attacks it makes against a target, if the target has been
attacked by an ally that is within 5 feet of the dreg before the start of the dreg's turn

action.name: Shock Pistol
entries: Firearm Weapon Attack: {@hit 3} to hit, scope
20/30/40 (close), one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) arc damage.

action.name: Shock Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5
ft., thrown 20/30 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) arc damage

action.name: Scan
entries: The shank scans in a 15 foot cone

action.name: Mark and Alarm
entries: The shank marks a target it can perceive
and begins broadcasting information about the target to
all allied shanks and servitors within 60 feet. Constructs
receiving this data have advantage on attack rolls they
make against a marked target. The shank can only mark
up to 3 targets at a time, and if it loses perception of a
marked target for 1 minute or longer, the target is no
longer marked by the shank.
When it marks a target, it also sounds an alarm that can
be heard clearly up to 300 feet away. This alarm continues
until all targets the shank have marked are destroyed,
until the shank is reset, or until the shank loses
perception of its marked targets.

trait.name: Vehicle Proficiencies
entries: tomb ship

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The knight takes two shots with its boomer cannon

action.name: Boomer Cannon
entries: Payload Firearm Weapon Attack: {@dc 14},
scope 60/120/340 (close), radius 5 ft. Failed save (half on
success): 14 ({@dice 2d10 + 3}) explosive arc damage

action.name: Cleaver
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one
target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d12 + 3}) slashing damage. If the knight is
holding this weapon with two hands when it hits with an
attack, it can use a bonus action to cause the attack to
deal an additional 21 ({@damage 6d6}) darkness damage.

reaction.name: Shield of Darkness (recharge d6 [5])
entries: If a creature makes a weapon attack against the knight, the knight can summon a shield of pure Darkness to completely negate all effects of the attack, including all damage or saving throws from payload weapons. The knight heals itself for 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points when it does this.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thrall makes two melee attacks

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one
target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) arc damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one
target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Shadowy Movement
entries: When in dim light or darkness, the acolyte can take the Disengage or Hide action as a bonus action on its turn

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The acolyte takes three shots with its shredder rifle

action.name: Shredder Rifle
entries: Firearm Weapon Attack: {@hit 4} to hit, scope 30/40/75 (close), one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d6d1 + 1}) void damage.

trait.name: Volatile
entries: If a creature moves within 5 feet of the shank, it can use self-destruct as a reaction. If the shank takes damage that would reduce it to 0 health points, it immediately uses its self-destruct.

action.name: Self-Destruct
entries: The bomb shank explodes, destroying itself. All targets within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@dice 5d6}) explosive solar damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

action.name: Scan
entries: The shank scans in a 15 foot cone

action.name: Mark and Alarm
entries: The shank marks a target it can perceive
and begins broadcasting information about the target to
all allied shanks and servitors within 60 feet. Constructs
receiving this data have advantage on attack rolls they
make against a marked target. The shank can only mark
up to 3 targets at a time, and if it loses perception of a
marked target for 1 minute or longer, the target is no
longer marked by the shank.
When it marks a target, it also sounds an alarm that can
be heard clearly up to 300 feet away. This alarm continues
until all targets the shank have marked are destroyed,
until the shank is reset, or until the shank loses
perception of its marked targets.

action.name: Turret
entries: Firearm Weapon Attack: {@hit 4} to hit, scope 20/30/40
(close), one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) arc damage.

trait.name: Volatile
entries: If a creature moves within 5 feet of the shank, it can use self-destruct as a reaction. If the shank takes damage that would reduce it to 0 health points, it immediately uses its self-destruct.

action.name: Self-Destruct
entries: The bomb shank explodes, destroying itself. All targets within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@dice 5d6}) explosive solar damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

action.name: Self-Destruct
entries: The cursed thrall explodes, destroying itself. All targets within 5 feet of it must make a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw, taking 17 ({@dice 5d6}) explosive arc damage on a failed saved, or half as much on a success.

reaction.name: Volatile
entries: If a creature moves within 5 feet of the thrall, it can use self-destruct as a reaction. If the thrall takes damage that would reduce it to 0 health points, it immediately uses its self-destruct

action.name: Gas Cloud
entries: The clutch produces toxic gas in a 10-foot spherical radius centered on itself. The gas lingers for up to 1 minute, spreads around corners, and any non-Hive or non-Taken creatures that enter the area of the gas must succeed on a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or become Poisoned for the next minute. Creatures Poisoned in this way have their movement speed halved and take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) poison damage at the start of each of their turns. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself early on a success.

action.name: Egg Sacs
entries: If the clutch is reduced to half its health points or less, several of its egg sacs will break open, producing 3 ({@dice 1d4 + 1}) thrall that appear in unoccupied spaces within 10 feet of the clutch. The thrall are considered friendly to allies of the clutch and take their turn on the clutch’s turn.
The clutch can benefit from this feature again if it is reduced to 0 health points, though doing so causes the clutch to wither and die immediately after.

action.name: Splinter Bow
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 6} to hit, range 20/60 ft., up to 3 targets within 5 feet of a point in range. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) solar damage.

action.name: Empowered Shot
entries: The attendant fires a single high-power shot from its splinter bow at a target within 60 feet. The target must make a {@dc 14} Strength saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) solar damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success. Creatures that fail the saving throw are also knocked Prone.

action.name: Shock Rifle
entries: Firearm Weapon Attack: {@hit 6} to hit, scope 15/120/240 (medium), one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) arc damage.

action.name: Shock Dagger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) arc damage.

trait.name: Vehicle Proficiencies
entries: heavy pike, pike, skiff

trait.name: Energy Shields
entries: Energy Shields 39 ({@dice 6d8+12}) arc

trait.name: Vicious
entries: Once on each of the captain's turns, it can increase the amount of damage it does with a successful weapon attack by 7 ({@dice 2d6}). The captain can choose to do this after it makes its attack roll, but before it rolls damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The captain makes two weapon attacks.

action.name: Shock Rifle
entries: Firearm Weapon Attack: {@hit 6} to hit, scope 15/120/240 (medium), one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) arc damage

action.name: Shock Smallsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) arc damage.

reaction.name: Blink (3/brief rest)
entries: If the captain is subject to a Strength saving throw, a Dexterity saving throw, or an attack from a source it can perceive, it can teleport to an unoccupied space within 10 feet, taking all carried and worn equipment with it. Doing so grants disadvantage on the attack, or advantage on the captain’s saving throw.

trait.name: Vehicle Proficiencies
entries: jumpships, sparrows

trait.name: Paracausal Resistance
entries: The Corsair has advantage on saving throws against spells, Light abilities, and Darkness effects

action.name: Sidearm
entries: Firearm Weapon Attack: {@hit 4} to hit, scope 20/30/40 (close), one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) kinetic damage

action.name: Shortsword
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft.,
one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Vehicle Proficiencies
entries: heavy pike, pike

trait.name: Shank Control (range: 300 ft)
entries: The shank master's computer allows it to wirelessly interface and communicate with shanks that are linked to it and within range. Linked shanks can share information such as their operational status, the friendly/hostile status of other creatures, and the location of creatures they can see.
As a bonus action on each of its turns, the shank master can choose a connected shank and direct it to move up to the shank's movement speed, or to take an action other than a multiattack action.

trait.name: Vandal Evasion (1/long rest)
entries: If the shank master fails a Dexterity saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Shock Rifle
entries: Firearm Weapon Attack: {@hit 5} to hit, scope 15/120/240 (medium), one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) arc damage.

action.name: Repair Unit (3 uses/short rest)
entries: Using spare parts they carry, the shank master can repair a shank, healing it for up to 10 ({@dice 3d6}) health points. If a shank is at 0 hit points, the shank master can spend 1 minute and attempt an Intelligence (Technology) check against a DC of 13 + the shank’s CR (minimum of +1). On a success, the shank regains 1 health point.
